docs.snippet: U.S. President Barack Obama expressed concern on Friday over Poland's moves to shackle its constitutional court, in unusually blunt comments calling on the former communist EU country's government to do more to protect democracy....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. President Barack Obama expressed concern on Friday over Poland's moves to shackle its constitutional court, in unusually blunt comments calling on the former communist EU country's government to do more to protect democracy.

headline.main: Poland Should Do More to Address Constitutional Court Concerns-Obama
headline.print_headline: Poland Should Do More to Address Constitutional Court Concerns-Obama

docs.snippet: U.S. President Barack Obama expressed concern Friday about the state of democracy in Poland, publicly rebuking a right-wing government that has paralyzed the constitutional court and taken steps to control state run media....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. President Barack Obama expressed concern Friday about the state of democracy in Poland, publicly rebuking a right-wing government that has paralyzed the constitutional court and taken steps to control state run media.

headline.main: Obama Rebukes Poland Over Paralysis of Constitutional Court
headline.print_headline: Obama Rebukes Poland Over Paralysis of Constitutional Court

docs.snippet: President Obama expressed concern over the Polish government’s constitutional crisis as a NATO summit meeting began in Warsaw....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama expressed concern over the Polish government’s constitutional crisis as a NATO summit meeting began in Warsaw.
docs.abstract: Pres Obama criticizes Poland’s right-wing government over changes to country's top court that make it nearly impossible to overturn new legislation; warns of move's detrimental effects on nation's democracy; comments form rare public rebuke of close American ally.

headline.print_headline: Obama Rebukes Poland Over Restrictions on Court

byline.original: By RICK LYMAN and JOANNA BERENDT

docs.snippet: Mrs. Clinton has slowly owned up to the trustworthiness problem. But it will take more than acknowledgment to fix the issue....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mrs. Clinton has slowly owned up to the trustworthiness problem. But it will take more than acknowledgment to fix the issue.
docs.abstract: Hillary Clinton, speaking in Chicago, signals shift in her presidential campaign strategy to try and directly address the lack of trust in her among likely voters.

headline.main: A More Personal Hillary Clinton Tries to Erase a Trust Deficit
headline.print_headline: A More Personal Clinton Tries to Rebuild Trust With Voters
